result.execSummary:
The defendant Stryder A. Winch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:07 AM Defendant Stryder A. Winch in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court for Stryder A. Winch. Cases 20TR1047, 20TR1048, 21TR251, 21CM51, 21CM239, and 22CM22.
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CM51 Defamation (repeater removed) - No Contest
22CM22 Count 1 Disorderly Conduct - No Contest
22CM22 Count 3 Bail Jumping - No Contest
21TR251 Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance 1st - Guilty


Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 21CM51, 22CM22 Counts 1 & 3, and 21TR251.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
22CM22 Counts 2 & 4, 21CM239, 20TR1047 and 20TR1048 are dismissed and read in.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is present by Zoom phone and approves the agreement as stated. 

ADA Jambois makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Bergner makes sentencing arguments to the court. 

BY THE COURT:
21TR251
$811.60 Fine To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan today.  
6 months Revocation of License
No order for Ignition Interlock Device
DOT Assessment and comply with Driver's Safety Plan. 

21CM51
90 days jail days in jail. consecutive to any other sentence
Huber is granted for work, counseling, and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
- STAYED - 
1 year Probation
Conditions of probation
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment / Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.
Sign a release for the case manager to monitor compliance with Mental Health / AODA treatment. 
Not to mention the victim in any way in any electronic format.
Pay costs and surcharges.

22CM22 Count 1
Serve 15  days in jail. consecutive to any other sentence
5  days credit.
Huber is granted for work, counseling, and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
- STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of 18  months.
Conditions of Probation: 
Same conditions as 21CM51. 
Pay costs and surcharges.

22CM22 Count 3
Serve 15  days in jail. consecutive to any other sentence
0 days credit.
Huber is granted for work, counseling, and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
- STAYED - 
Placed on probation for a period of 18  months.
Same conditions as 21CM51.
Pay costs and surcharges.

Defendant Stryder A Winch in court. Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears in court for Defendant, for the criminal cases. Defendant is pro se on the traffic cases.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are:
Final Pretrial: 20TR-1047, 21TR-251, 20TR-1048.
Status Conference : 21CM-239, 21CM-51.
Pretrial conference : 22CM-22.

Atty Jambois states appearances.

These matters were on the calendar for a final pretrial conference.
Defendant is accepting the plea agreement.

State requests matters to be set for a plea and sentencing. 
Atty Jambois states that the jury trial should be cancelled.

BY THE COURT:
Plea and sentencing hearings are set in all cases. 
Jury trial is cancelled.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on February 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:41 PM Defendant Stryder A. Winch in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial Appearance set for January 24, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1

1:50 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Criminal Damage to Property, and Disorderly Conduct and Bail Jumping.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court will adopt the $500 signature bond as requested by the State with the conditions as stated on the record.

Initial Appearance scheduled for:   January 24, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
No contact with the address as stated on the record or any residence of that resident
